idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

descript.abstract: REQUIRED: A brief narrative summary of the data set.
descript.purpose: REQUIRED: A summary of the intentions with which the data set was developed.

citeinfo.origin: REQUIRED: The name of an organization or individual that developed the data set.
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.
citeinfo.title: GreenBelt2011

timeperd.current: REQUIRED: The basis on which the time period of content information is determined.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

status.progress: REQUIRED: The state of the data set.
status.update: REQUIRED: The frequency with which changes and additions are made to the data set after the initial data set is completed.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.
theme.themekey: REQUIRED: Common-use word or phrase used to describe the subject of the data set.

idinfo.accconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing the data set.
idinfo.useconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for using the data set after access is granted.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Green Belt geographical extents provided by 197 English Local Authorities for the 2007 year end. Some Local Authorities were able to provide better quality data for their 2007 greenbelt boundaries. This dataset was therefore updated at the start of 2009, but represents greenbelt coverage in 2007.
A related table is available which lists 2007 Score (Gold / Silver / Wooden spoon etc), 2007 Published figure, 2007 Actual figure, 2007 BF figure, New 2007 BF figure (where the LA had submitted a revised 2007 BF), Final 2007 BF Figure (a combination of the previous two columns), Difference between Final 2007 BF figure and 2007 Actual figure, % difference between Final 2007 BF figure and 2007 Actual figure, New 2007 Score (A/B/C), Notes - especially where a LA has requested publication of a figure which is different to the BF figure.
Scores are as follows: - A: BF figure within 10ha of published figure - B: BF figure within 50ha of published figure AND less than 0.5% different (preferably with explanation why) - C: Difference between BF figure and published figure worse than above (preferably with explanation why)

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.
cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: Applications accepted from public sector bodies or those working on behalf of government. Non commercial use only. Hounslow LA has specified that use of their data is dependant on having a license to use derived Ordnance Survey (MasterMap) data: PGA / MSA licensees or those with a specific MasterMap license.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

dataLineage.statement: CLG assigned a quality threshold based on area calculations. See related attribute table for more information. The quality criteria are: * Gold - Pass : where the area calculated is within 10ha of the published figure. * Gold? - Pass :where the area calculated is within 10ha of the published figure but there is no metadata referring to scale of data capture. * Gold - Pass 2006 : where the area calculated falls within the 10ha of the published figure but only with using the 2006 figure. * Silver - Pass : where the area calculated is within 50ha AND less than 0.5% different from the published figure. * Silver? - Pass : where the area calculated is within 50ha AND less than 0.5% different from the published figure but there is no metadata referring to scale of data capture. * Bronze - Pass : where the area calculated differs from the published figure due to the LA using MapInfo (or another GIS) which calculates areas using Spherical methodology as opposed to Cartesian. * Bronze? - Pass : where the area calculated differs from the published figure due to the LA using MapInfo (or another GIS) which calculates areas using Spherical methodology as opposed to Cartesian but there is no metadata referring to scale of data capture. * Does not meet CLG Standard - Fail : where the area calculated doesn’t fall within 50ha of the published figure and is greater than 0.5% different from the published figure.
